name: Reverse Words in a String II
title: Reverse Words in a String II
content:
Given a character array s, reverse the order of the words.

A word is defined as a sequence of non-space characters. The words in s will be separated by a single space.

Your code must solve the problem in-place, i.e. without allocating extra space.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = ["t","h","e"," ","s","k","y"," ","i","s"," ","b","l","u","e"]
Output: ["b","l","u","e"," ","i","s"," ","s","k","y"," ","t","h","e"]

Example 2:

Input: s = ["a"]
Output: ["a"]

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 105
  • s[i] is an English letter (uppercase or lowercase), digit, or space ' '.
  • There is at least one word in s.
  • s does not contain leading or trailing spaces.
  • All the words in s are guaranteed to be separated by a single space.

discussion_posts.name: user3801tN
discussion_posts.content: its so annoying this question says allocate no extraspace, but it really means the space complexity must constant O(1)

discussion_posts.name: matthewjinmp
discussion_posts.content: i refuse to do this dirty undergoing in place

discussion_posts.name: rioran
discussion_posts.content: I checked top speed solutions in Python. I faced some short ones with string concatenation. Which contradicts the condition of "NO EXTRA SPACE" since making a string out of list kinda duplicates the memory required.

discussion_posts.name: swarnabh_kashyap1
discussion_posts.content: So this is easier than Reverse Words in a String 1 :/

discussion_posts.name: Kyochi
discussion_posts.content: Hello\n\ni don't understand why the time complexity is O(n) instead of O(n\xb2) or O(n+kw) cause of reverse word operation. k number of word.

discussion_posts.name: thepha3drus
discussion_posts.content:
It was an interview question at one of the BIG 4.  

At a high level, this seems like an application of breaking the input in chunks (intermedia files) and then merging the results. 

But, I was looking for a solution that is more in-depth.

discussion_posts.name: omrocks
